title: Credit Given by Exam  |  Test Credit & Placement  |  Admission & Aid  |  DePaul University | DePaul University, Chicago
content: Admission & Aid Types of Admission Visit DePaul Tuition Room & Board Scholarships Financial Aid Veteran Student Test Credit & PlacementCredit Given by ExamOnline Placement Process Credit Given by Exam Online Placement Process Check Your Application Status Admitted Students Deadlines Immunization Apply Online Request Info Visit Campus DePaul University>Admission & Aid>Test Credit & Placement>Credit Given by Exam Credit Given By Exam If you participate in AP, CLEP, IB and/or International A & A/S Level exams, you may earn college credit at DePaul. Additionally, DePaul accepts theSeal of Biliteracyfor college credit for students with this distinction. Learn which exams DePaul accepts, the scores required and the course credit you will earn: Advanced Placement (AP) College Level Examination Program (CLEP) International Baccalaureate (IB) A & A/S Level (Cambridge International Examinations) Seal of Biliteracy Your scores must be sent directly to DePaul from the testing agencies. Scores will not be accepted from your high school or former college transcripts. Credit policies are reviewed annually.
